titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 22) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; providing for proceedings during the period from November 6, 2015, through November 13, 2015; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 22) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; providing for proceedings during the period from November 6, 2015, through November 13, 2015; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-325, by Mr. Woodall.

Resolution provides for consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 22; provides for proceedings during the period from Nov. 6, 2015 through Nov. 13, 2015; and provides for motions to suspend the rules.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 71.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in House

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 507.
ORDERING THE PREVIOUS QUESTION - Mr. Woodall moved the previous question on the amendment and on the resolution.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241 - 178 (Roll no. 583).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 171 (Roll no. 584).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 22 (Developing a Reliable and Innovative Vision for the Economy Act [DRIVE Act]).
